greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: a(n) = 8*Lucas(n).
link: Bruno Berselli, Table of n, a(n) for n = 0..300
Index entries for linear recurrences with constant coefficients, signature (1,1).
formula: a(n)   = Fibonacci(n+6) - Fibonacci(n-6), where Fibonacci(-6..-1) = -8, 5, -3, 2, -1, 1 (see similar sequences listed in Crossrefs).
a(n)   = Lucas(n+4) + Lucas(n) + Lucas(n-4), where Lucas(-4..-1) = 7, -4, 3, -1.
mathematica: CoefficientList[Series[8*(2 - x)/(1 - x - x^2), {x, 0, 50}], x] (* _G. C. Greubel_, Dec 21 2017 *)
xref: Cf. sequences with the formula Fibonacci(n+k)-Fibonacci(n-k): A000045 (k=1); A000032 (k=2); A022087 (k=3); A022379 (k=4, without initial 6); A022345 (k=5); this sequence (k=6); A022363 (k=7).
results.author: _Bruno Berselli_, May 22 2015
